articles.title: Weather Wednesday: Why are we gaining daylight?

articles.summary: It is getting lighter for longer at night in the past few weeks. The Earth is tilted at a 23.5 degree angle and the Earth revolves around the sun. Days get longer between the Winter Solstice and the summer solstice and shorter between the summer and winter solstices. Daylight Saving Time starts on March 9th and we gain an hour of daylight.

The western part of the ice sheet has the potential to stabilize the ice mass, but if it loses its connection to coastal areas, it could lead to the loss of over 80% of the mass. The complete melting of the Greenland Ice sheet could cause a rise in sea levels by as much as seven meters and disrupt global weather patterns.
